question:
Consider the following statements about National Nutrition Mission (NNM):
  1. It is being implemented under the aegis of Ministry of Women and Child Development
  2. The mission aims to reduce the stunting and low birth weights by 8% by 2022
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. The mission is being implemented under the aegis of Ministry of Women and Child Development. The National Nutrition Mission is being funded by the Government Budgetary Support (50% of the total) and 50% by the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) or other Multilateral Development Banks (MDB). In case of National Nutrition Mission (NNM), the Government budgetary support would be 60:40 between Centre and States/UTs, 90:10 for NER and Himalayan States and 100% for UTs without the legislature. <u>Second statement is incorrect</u>. The mission aims to reduce low birth weight by 2%, 2%, 3% and 2% per annum respectively and targets to reduce stunting is at-least 2% per annum. This mission would strive to achieve a reduction in Stunting from 38.4% (NFHS-4) to 25% by 2022 (Mission 25 by 2022).
